H0.text: Spring is water that flows out of the ground where an aquifer meets the surface.

H1.text: Oasis is water that flows out of the ground where an aquifer meets the surface.

H2.text: Waterfall is the water that flows out of the ground where an aquifer meets the surface.

H3.text: A stream is water that flows out of the ground where an aquifer meets the surface.

A4.text: A spring is a natural exit point at which groundwater emerges from an aquifer and flows across the ground surface as surface water.

A5.text: Springs are driven out onto the surface by various natural forces, such as gravity and hydrostatic pressure.
